title: Spanish for Heritage and Native Speakers I
subject: World Languages (2013-2019)

C7B809E8E6E7494C91E57466493BEFD2.description:
Explore personal occupation opportunities available in which Spanish language abilities are beneficial 
(e.g., career requirements, educational plan)

41D096CA8E214D48B818128966B697E5.description:
Identify ways to communicate and/or collaborate with speakers of the Spanish language 
(e.g., pen pals, e-pals, audio recordings, video recordings)

040114DD320345B39570188E6ACAD2CF.description: Identify available Spanish literature (e.g., informational brochures, official documents, library resources)

6E931A5F39BE49318B68A8D6517CBA39.description: Identify authentic activities within the local Spanish-speaking communities (e.g., sports, games, travel, media, music)

CE158EEC1F494DA9847A8AD9E374D263.description: Identify organizations that support Spanish-speaking communities

5BE59D1E6F424C49A830F4ECA2B4299D.description: Use Spanish language skills in the classroom, using available technology as appropriate

74C7C3BDAF3B4BE08A5B4E7D05333D69.description: Identify local businesses and/or media in Spanish-speaking communities

70FF3CA3C92E48AD89D0F8EA95B237F6.description:
Identify social conventions
(e.g., meeting new people, dating, school, employment, transportation)

A4890B5FF33C4EF890FD898631083289.description:
Recognize social and religious beliefs and views of Spanish-speaking communities
(e.g., social hierarchy, religion)

51F90D3201014F358D86775DE64BD5C1.description:
Recognize cultural traditions and celebrations of Spanish-speaking communities 
(e.g., visual arts, music, dance, food)

A135FFAE76184E11A78649284B382E4A.description:
Identify Anglicisms, false cognates, and code switching
(e.g., parquear, asistir/atender)

31720ADD76784BCC900849B944E189CB.description: Identify indigenous languages of Spanish-speaking countries

CAA992E13F9547139E0691F0FFEA9B09.description: Identify different dialects and pronunciations used in Spanish-speaking countries and the United States

FC7EA82CA6524843B88DB94017CF1278.description: Identify idioms, regionalisms, and colloquialisms from various Spanish-speaking countries

7CFD8FE549E847CFAEE4291EA6489364.description:
Identify products of Spanish-speaking cultures that are found in other cultures 
(e.g., piñata, chocolate, sugar cane, coffee, the arts)

3AE4EB85885B4300868B82FA98CDF22F.description:
Analyze, in standard Spanish using authentic Spanish sources, the influence of the United States as viewed by various Spanish-speaking peoples
(e.g., literary viewpoints, political   policies, stereotypes)

380D5A25EB5B4FD898EAD80171068316.description:
Identify political systems found in the United States and the Spanish-speaking world 
(e.g., democracy, monarchy)

AD55EBE48FE94BB5BB6B34DEB3FD5BE4.description: Identify superstitions and legends (e.g., Chupacabra, Siguanaba, Yerba Mate, el duende)

A92CD5C13CAB44C68D148BFEAD384598.description: Identify regions/countries where Spanish is the predominant or official language

5393D2104D6948DEB0D3D069960E7E94.description:
Recognize the influence of  notable Spanish speakers 
(e.g., Sonia Sotomayor, Carlos Slim, Eva Perón, Diego Rivera)

C0D0D59824E14DFC850D013F8EDAFF9D.description: Recognize the dialects of various geographical regions

56D398B85E8845FF85454E27BABAC37D.description: Identify authentic research sources in various disciplines

6943C53E04CF4DDFAA4E3AB0815882D2.description: Identify examples of artistic expression in Spanish-speaking communities (e.g., dance, music, art, film/video)

75E1B60E7BD44F51A1D5BE5BE5A60B76.description: Identify various modern Spanish-speaking communities in the United States and the world

9E8BA7B0703D47D2B2813BC5AA74521B.description:
Identify various pre-Columbian societies 
(e.g., Incas, Aztecs, Taironas, Muiscas, Taínos, Mayas)

644AD00DC0444702B75C4F68D71D926C.description: Recognize facts, informed opinions, and bias in mass media, multimedia, and the Internet

449DA9A842FF48F3882AF69B069CAF8A.description:
Discuss unique cultural perspectives reflected in products  
(e.g., piñata, abanico, mate)

636C735A717E496ABDA9C055981BCF75.description: Describe the geography of Spanish-speaking communities

6F46485C8FB5407CA20F63619DD5A70C.description:
Recognize the influence of contemporary events on individual and group perspectives 
(e.g., elections, immigration)

F04ACECD462741FDBCA54C9E83EA5D12.description:
Recognize the influence of historical events and figures on individual and group perspectives 
(e.g., revolutionary movements, Emiliano Zapata, Simón Bolívar)

E40A10A6A22E4DD79746858C3DFE6AFA.description:
Discuss the relationship between environments and products of Spanish-speaking cultures 
(e.g., geography, climate, natural resources, politics, society, migration)

2F999D1520494E618954362E71E525BA.description:
Investigate historical contributions of Spanish-speaking communities to the rest of the world through literature and music 
(e.g., “Un día de estos” by Gabriel García Márquez, flamenco)

3EE52CF42813400AB9DC2D8FAFA216D6.description:
Describe artistic expression of the Spanish-speaking world 
(e.g., visual art, music, dance, plays)

EB025EA81F87401B9CDD12CDF4D65511.description: Identify products and perspectives of indigenous groups of Spanish-speaking people found in the United States and the world

B6E38202D8024BAD8C2BCA968769A036.description:
Discuss unique cultural perspectives reflected in practices  
(e.g., las posadas, La Tomatina, corridas)

EBBB21CE238940A79C59B5FA18B4B765.description: Identify gender roles in history, literature, and the media in Spanish-speaking communities found in the United States and the world

BADFE7C4646945F0B8F851ED6B8AF960.description: Identify culturally appropriate behaviors in a variety of situations (e.g., verbal and nonverbal greetings, gestures, customs, expressions)

80E1D94E8B904975B7F82F41181095FC.description:
Identify the influence of other cultures on the language of Spanish-speaking communities 
(e.g., lonche, parquear)

3243C029171D4C889704C4CF18C8E703.description: Identify social, historical, and literary traditions and viewpoints of Spanish-speaking communities found in the United States and the world

8A37D7F407774D0AB3E1B2F00F51481B.description:
Produce level-appropriate visual or multimedia demonstrations with special characters using available technology 
(e.g., poster, brochure, slideshow, blog, podcast)

F09DC8799F484A078F922DE65E9B5B37.description: Write a variety of texts using graphic organizers for pre-writing and rubrics for peer editing

A21C2E25DA6E47AC91279CE1010971C8.description: Illustrate various historic events from Spanish-speaking communities in the United States and the world

6D686584CF5F48C28FF67C1FF2E0DAA4.description: Sustain fluid, sequential, straight-forward written and/or verbal presentations on a variety of topics

3699C34DBB5F49CDA0CA8245201D82A2.description: Write simple formal and informal compositions on a variety of topics

68498F0683174003A47EAEE9070ABEFD.description: Apply numeric concepts in context in oral and written forms (cardinal numbers 0+, ordinal numbers 1st – 20th)

29070A1D4A054178A4CFAB47FF5298AE.description: Communicate using linguistic, structural, and grammatical variations (punctuation, simple sentence structure (e.g., subject-verb agreement, placement), spelling (e.g., accents))

5637B467C9684407A829403804D16EAD.description:
Identify skills to exchange information about unfamiliar topics
(e.g., circumlocution, gestures)

81788410860A425EB0F4072A5F7CEC12.description: Identify, conjugate, and communicate present and past tenses in context (immediate future, imperfect, present indicative, preterite, progressive)

11FE9EF9D8064587AADD1210D6A8FCF8.description: Discuss historical events through authentic literary texts

68FA18BC9BAF41A094C38D7303F5D460.description: Express feelings, emotions, and opinions orally and in writing

8E7A44B9956A4F76BFCCCA40F6718033.description:
Correspond in standard Spanish using appropriate register 
(e.g., letter, e-mail)

F932E205198245748289243C359B79CF.description: Initiate spontaneous conversation (e.g., greetings, quick questions)

9E4D130B6BDD4A06AB2CF88B0AFF46F6.description: Exchange ideas and information about familiar and routine matters using appropriate register

78A083AD00A3418E85352A7A801F1D21.description:
Identify intonation of syllables to recognize accentuation 
(e.g., papa vs. papá, hablo vs. habló)

347AFC64B4B8495A834626142C1E4E25.description: Identify cognates, borrowings, idiomatic expressions, abbreviations, and acronyms in context

17CFE7C80D6C4E8AA716092BF342E219.description:
Interpret simple correspondence from a variety of sources and registers 
(e.g., informal letters, business letters, notes, e-mail)

6EB6296BA1C44477B19CF35DC45D54F1.description:
Follow multi-step directions in familiar contexts 
(e.g., recipes, map directions)

59AC7E8820C844499876253BFC7A249C.description:
Identify literary styles and techniques 
(e.g., classical literature, modern literature)

78CE3252125D412C9AC02B15EAEDB4E6.description: Identify main ideas, setting, theme, characters, and details in short contextualized and adapted texts

9E20D2DE4CB4434492C5D7E8968E55E9.description:
Identify the structure of short contextualized and adapted texts on a variety of topics 
(e.g., stanza, introduction, thesis)

FA3D8A51C18843DB9FCA389FDBA362F6.description:
Identify the structure of short contextualized and adapted texts on a variety of topics
